primary_content.title: Our Preclinical Expertise
primary_content.description:
Renal denervation devices treat resistant hypertension by disrupting sympathetic nerves surrounding renal arteries. These catheter-based systems must prove they can achieve complete nerve ablation while preserving renal artery integrity and kidney function. Whether using radiofrequency energy or ultrasound, devices need validation showing sustained blood pressure reduction without nerve regrowth over time.

We test nerve ablation effectiveness through specialized immunohistochemistry that visualizes sympathetic fiber destruction, measuring norepinephrine levels to confirm functional denervation, and tracking blood pressure changes that demonstrate therapeutic benefit. Our protocols evaluate energy delivery consistency across varying vessel anatomies, ensuring circumferential ablation without creating arterial injury. From acute safety assessment through extended reinnervation studies, our testing addresses the complete validation path these hypertension devices require.

ISO 10993 biocompatibility standards guide chronic arterial contact assessment while FDA guidance for neurological devices informs ablation validation protocols. Our testing supports both early feasibility studies under IDE applications and comprehensive PMA submissions. Whether validating radiofrequency catheter designs or ultrasound transducer arrays, our protocols demonstrate the ablation completeness and renal safety FDA expects for hypertension treatment devices.

capabilities.title: Sympathetic Nerve Ablation Verification
capabilities.description: Specialized immunohistochemistry visualizes sympathetic fiber destruction while norepinephrine analysis confirms functional denervation, with quantitative protocols characterizing ablation depth and completeness across arterial segments.

capabilities.title: Energy Delivery Characterization
capabilities.description: Temperature and impedance monitoring track radiofrequency energy distribution and tissue contact quality while ultrasound mapping validates focal zones, penetration depth, and circumferential coverage achieving complete denervation.

capabilities.title: Renal Artery Safety and Function Assessment
capabilities.description: Angiography and intravascular ultrasound evaluate arterial integrity and healing while renal function monitoring confirms preserved kidney performance throughout chronic observation periods.

capabilities.title: Chronic Reinnervation Evaluation
capabilities.description: Serial nerve fiber assessment at multiple timepoints detects sympathetic regrowth while blood pressure monitoring identifies therapeutic durability, with histological analysis characterizing long-term ablation stability.

capabilities.title: Catheter Performance and Electrode Contact
capabilities.description: Delivery system testing evaluates navigation through renal anatomy and electrode positioning while impedance monitoring confirms tissue contact and multi-electrode systems demonstrate circumferential ablation coverage.

capabilities.title: Blood Pressure Response and Therapeutic Efficacy
capabilities.description: Continuous hemodynamic monitoring tracks acute and chronic blood pressure changes with ambulatory assessment characterizing sustained response and protocols evaluating bilateral versus unilateral denervation effectiveness.
